sense.name: modification or alteration of state
sense.commentary: CHANGE[+state][+alteration] Note: 'change' functions as an attribute of an event or entity
sense.examples: John could see a change in Mary's face after her vacation. There's been a sea change in Washington. The pathologist determined the changes in the cell tissue were not cancerous. The children's science project was to observe the moon's nightly changes for a month.

sense.name: currency, physical money
sense.examples: I think the waiter gave me back the wrong change. I need to get change for this hundred dollar bill. In the recording industry, ten thousand dollars is chump change. Mary found only small change in the kitchen drawer.

sense.name: the process of transformation
sense.commentary: CHANGE[+process][+transformation] Note: 'change' is not describing an attribute of an event or thing, it -is- the event.
sense.examples: It was a nice change to play bridge last evening. Geological change is usually too slow for us to see directly.

sense.name: merchandise swapped for other merchandise
sense.examples: You can make a change for a different color, if you don't like the red one I bought you.

sense.name: a fresh set of clothing
sense.examples: Pack a change in your overnight bag. Clark Kent made a quick change in the phone booth. Sally brought only one change of evening wear on the cruise.
